docs.abstract: Steve Jobs tried to create a manufacturing culture in Silicon Valley. As one former Apple engineer put it, "It wasn't great for business."

headline.main: Apple Computers Used to Be Built in the U.S. It Was a Mess.

docs.abstract: The most consequential hit to the bottom line may be from people, including longtime fans, who are holding on to their phones longer.
docs.snippet: The most consequential hit to the bottom line may be from people, including longtime fans, who are holding on to their phones longer.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Apple lost more than $75 billion in market value this past week after a surprise announcement that it is expecting lower iPhone sales than originally projected, the company put most of the blame for its troubles on China, where a slowing economy and the trade war with the United States have hurt sales.

docs.abstract: What was once an extra is now a necessity, as companies give their employees free ice cream and beer, Pop-Tarts and prime rib — often with an agenda attached.
docs.snippet: What was once an extra is now a necessity, as companies give their employees free ice cream and beer, Pop-Tarts and prime rib — often with an agenda attached.
docs.lead_paragraph: Everyone who works at Ben & Jerry’s headquarters in Burlington, Vt., is entitled to three free pints of ice cream for each day of work. At the American Enterprise Institute, a conservative think tank in Washington, employees are treated daily to an elaborate buffet with appropriately white-shoe fare like prime rib, crab cakes and housemade beignets.

headline.main: There Is a Free Lunch, After All. It’s at the Office.
headline.print_headline: There Is a Free Lunch: It’s at the Office

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research

docs.abstract: His tweets criticize Facebook and Google, but the Antitrust Division of the Justice Department is making life easier for potential monopolists in Silicon Valley.
docs.snippet: His tweets criticize Facebook and Google, but the Antitrust Division of the Justice Department is making life easier for potential monopolists in Silicon Valley.
docs.lead_paragraph: At his Senate confirmation hearing, Attorney General William Barr signaled an interest in confronting the power of big tech corporations like Facebook and Google. As Mr. Barr put it, a lot “of people wonder how such huge behemoths that now exist in Silicon Valley have taken shape under the nose of the antitrust enforcers.” And since taking office, President Trump has repeatedly attacked America’s biggest technology corporations, especially Amazon, Facebook and Google. Among other accusations, he has charged Amazon with ripping off the Post Office and Google with  censoring conservative users. He recently criticized Facebook, Google and Twitter for “ridiculous” bias in favor of Democrats. By most appearances, Mr. Trump is a foe of big tech.

byline.original: By Matthew Buck and Sandeep Vaheesan

docs.abstract: The former executive, who oversaw compliance with insider trading rules, was accused by the S.E.C. of profiting on nonpublic information.
docs.snippet: The former executive, who oversaw compliance with insider trading rules, was accused by the S.E.C. of profiting on nonpublic information.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A former senior lawyer at Apple who oversaw the company’s insider trading policies was himself accused of insider trading by federal prosecutors and securities regulators in complaints made public on Wednesday.

headline.main: Former Senior Apple Lawyer Charged With Insider Trading
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Accuses Senior Lawyer Of Trade Fraud While at Apple

docs.lead_paragraph: Hi there! Here you are, rushing around with too many plans, not enough holiday shopping done and perhaps a mild headache from last night’s mulled wine. The least we can give you is a quick rundown of what’s going on in the business world. If you like what you’re reading and haven’t already subscribed, click here — and then forward to a friend if you’re feeling generous.

headline.main: The Week in Business: Apple Expands in Austin, and the Fed Gears Up on Interest Rates
